history.content:
This is coming from someone who hasn’t taken any of the classes yet, but seriously contemplated taking a couple of the classes and did some decent research on all the classes.

Using HKN surveys as a guide, I consider 4.0 and above workload to be high, 3.6 to 3.9 to be medium, and anything 3.5 and below to be low. 170 averaged between 4.9 and 4.3 over the last couple of years.  169 was between 3.6 and 3.8, and 186 was between 3.3 and 3.6.  So I would say that you’re taking one high load class, one medium, and one low-medium.  Which sounds like a good mix to me.

I wonder why the EECS pages say that 169 is a high workload class?

This is coming from someone who hasn’t taken any of the classes but seriously contemplated taking a couple of the classes and did some decent research on all the classes.

Using HKN surveys as a guide, I consider 4.0 and above workload to be high, 3.6 to 3.9 to be medium, and anything 3.5 and below to be low. 170 averaged between 4.9 and 4.3 over the last couple of years.  169 was between 3.6 and 3.8, and 186 was between 3.3 and 3.6.  So I would say that you’re taking one high load class, one medium, and one low-medium.  Which sounds like a good mix to me.

I wonder why the EECS pages say that 169 is a high workload class?

children.subject:
CS 170 is a pretty high workload class. Weekly homework sets which can easily take 10+ hours. Then the studying for exams which also is a significant amount of time.

CS 169 is basically a full project based course, where you have a group and a project to work on all semester. If you have a bad group or slack off, you will not have a fun or good time. It CAN be a bit time consuming, but exams are pretty straightforward and can use the computers.

CS 186 is intense workload when homeworks are released (one every ~2-3 weeks). The exams are very fair and if you studied, you will get a good grade. No “tricks” or curveballs, literally straight from lectures, worksheets, etc. 

If you want to do well in all 3 classes (A- or higher), then you will be spending a good chunk of your time dedicated to your classes for sure.

history.content: Hi all! Just looking for a second opinion. I'm considering doing CS W186, CS 170, and CS 169 in one semester without any other significant classes, does that sound doable? I've already taken all recommended prereqs for all classes in addition to CS 162 and 188.
history.subject: Courses: W186 + 170 + 169?

history.content: Hi all! Just looking for a second opinion. I'm considering doing CS W186, CS 170, and CS 169 in one semester without any other significant classes, does that sound doable? I've already taken all recommended prereqs for all classes.
